text: this week is a showdown week for the
health care bill in the Senate senator
Mitch McConnell the majority leader is
expected to move on Tuesday to take up a
health care bill for debate that means
that the first vote that will take place
on Tuesday will be a motion to proceed
we've had difficulty in getting 50 votes
he needs 50 votes to proceed to a health
care bill we know that they've lost one
Susan Collins of Maine who has said she
will not vote to proceed of the health
care debate on Monday night Senator John
McCain of Arizona surprised Washington
by announcing that he will be flying on
Tuesday to Washington from Arizona
despite brain cancer to take part in the
big vote on health care the decision by
McCain to be on hand really changed the
momentum of this bill I think there's a
sense now that Republican senators will
say I don't want John McCain to have
made this flight for nothing will at
least take up this bill if senator Mitch
McConnell gets the 50 votes to proceed
to health care the next step will be to
replace the bill that he brings to the
floor which is the house-passed health
care bill that no one likes with a
simple bill to repeal the Affordable
Care Act without a replacement that
almost certainly will be voted down it
just doesn't have that much support
simply saying we're going to repeal this
and think about it later that's not an
option for me
he will then move to repeal and
replacement and that bill has more
support than repealing without replacing
but that too has a tough road ahead of
it it is not clear that that has 50
votes
[Music]
